title: P06-1013

sentences.text: Combination methods are an effective way of improving system performance .
This paper examines the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD .
We investigate several voting - and arbiter-based combination strategies over a diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems .
Our combination methods rely on predominant senses which are derived automatically from raw text .
Experiments using the SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets demonstrate that our ensembles yield significantly better results when compared with state-of-the-art .

Entity-our_combination_method.label: Our combination methods
Entity-our_combination_method.description: A set of approaches that combine multiple unsupervised WSD systems to improve their performance by relying on predominantly sensed meanings automatically extracted from raw text.

summary: Combination methods are an effective way of improving system performance . This paper examines the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD . We investigate several voting - and arbiter-based combination strategies over a diverse pool of unsupervised WSD systems . Our combination methods rely on predominant senses which are derived automatically from raw text . Experiments using the SemCor and Senseval-3 data sets demonstrate that our ensembles yield significantly better results when compared with state-of-the-art .

Predicate-are_an_effective_way_of_improv.label: are an effective way of improving
Predicate-are_an_effective_way_of_improv.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has a direct and significant impact on achieving or enhancing the object. It suggests a causal relationship between the subject's existence or application and the improvement of the object, implying a positive outcome.

Predicate-examines.label: examines
Predicate-examines.description: To examine a predicate means to investigate or analyze its properties, characteristics, or implications. In this sense, the subject (in this case, 'This paper') scrutinizes and interprets the object (the benefits of system combination for unsupervised WSD), seeking to understand its significance, relevance, or potential impact.

Predicate-derive_automatically_from.label: derive automatically from
Predicate-derive_automatically_from.description: This predicate indicates that the subject generates or obtains its characteristics, properties, or rules directly and immediately from the object. The connection between the subject and object implies a causal relationship where the object serves as the source of inspiration, guidance, or foundation for the subject's development.

Predicate-demonstrate_that.label: demonstrate that
Predicate-demonstrate_that.description: To predicate 'demonstrate that' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g., Experiments) provides evidence or proof to support or validate the object (e.g., our ensembles), typically implying a test, verification, or validation process.

Predicate-yield_significantly_better_res.label: yield significantly better results when compared with
Predicate-yield_significantly_better_res.description: This predicate indicates a comparative advantage or superiority of the subject over the object. It suggests that the subject has a notable edge or performance gain when compared to the object, implying a positive difference between them.

Predicate-examine.label: examine
Predicate-examine.description: To examine means to investigate or scrutinize something in order to gain a deeper understanding or insight. It implies a systematic and thorough analysis, often with the goal of identifying patterns, relationships, or underlying principles.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or subcategory of a more general category or domain represented by the object. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject is a narrower or more specialized version of the object.
